runs.comm: shortish ball curving away outside off, a thick inside-edge sends the ball towards fine leg, not the most confident of starts from the out-of-form Kusal
tight around off, 126.6kph, left alone by Jayawardene
back of a length ball, Mahela skips down the track, gets nowhere near the pitch of the ball, but still goes through with the shot, gets enough on it to send the ball over mid-on
flings this too far outside off
length ball closer to off stump, Mahela looks to drive through the off after taking a tiny step forward, he misses
Mahela is known for his touchplay, and he's showing it off here, a back of a length ball on off stump, hardly any power as he flicks that, helped by the breeze to the midwicket boundary

Tsostsobe gets the big wicket, South Africa are jubilant as Jayawardene has nicked one through to the keeper, that was short of a length and outside off, nothing alarming about the delivery, the angle took the ball across him, a bit of a nothing push forward from Jayawardene, bottom hand comes off as he pushes at the ball
starts with a wide and full ball outside off
full and wide again, closer to the stumps this time, Kusal throws the bat at it and is beaten
length ball on the pads, gets behind the line and defends

a chipped four for Kusal, a length ball from round the wicket, Kusal doesn't look to power this one, happy to use the wind to take it well past the man at mid-on, somewhat similar to the boundary Mahela got in the previous over
full and on the stumps, pushed towards de Villiers for a quick single, Kusal easily makes his ground so de Villiers can't return the run-out favour
pitched up and slanting into the pads, 140kph, whipped around square leg
short of a length and on off stump, watchful defence towards mid-on
length ball on offstump, tight line from Tsotsobe, defended by the under-fie Chandimal
short ball on leg stump, awkwardly fended away by Chandimal, off the arm guard towards square leg

whoah, that looked like a massive hit from Kusal Perera but it was into the wind and it doesn't carry all the way to the rope, in act Parnell has time to come across to midwicket and field that, it was a short of a length ball outside off
pokes this towards point for a single
around off stump, 130kph, defended off the front foot towards the off side
shorter this time, keeps it around the off stump, 130kph, Chandimal is pegged back, he defends from the crease
another boundary for Kusal, great start to the over, this was pitched up by Morkel, no feet at all from Kusal as lofts that over mid-off
on a length, effortlessly driven between cover and point for four, timing and placement is perfect there, another boundary for Kusal
on legstump, defended to the leg side by Kusal
short of length ball strikes Perera on the pads, that was sliding down the leg side, Morkel puts in a mild lbw appeal, there was an inside-edge as well there
pitched up and just outside off, left alone by Kusal
back of a length ball on the pads, a leg-bye in front of point
a bit of width there from Tsotsobe, Chandimal happy to allow it through to the keeper

full and wide outside off, Chandimal chases that one with a wild lash, wanted to power that through cover, a thin edge through to the keeper, Chandimal's poor record in T20s becomes poorer still, for a minute he hopes for a reprieve as the umpires check for the no-ball, no problem there for Tsotsobe, and Chandimal is on his way
Sangakkara begins with a careful defence to the off side
length ball just outside off, inside-edged onto the pads, the ball drops to leg side, not too far away from the stumps, the batsmen scramble a single

Kusal nearly throws away his wicket once more, seriously lucky there that the ball lands just wide of two fielders, both Parnell and Wiese were after it, neither seemed to spotted the other, luckily there is no collision, and luckily for Kusal it is wide of both of them, it was a short ball from Tsotsobe, Kusal top-edges a pull, for a moment he would have thought that his innings was ended early thanks to a wild shot, he's still there though
short of a length and just outside off, eased towards point
Parnell's first ball is defended down the track
Sangakkara given some width, he chases after the ball and connects well, sends it screaming to the point boundary
Parnell gets the outside edge with a ball is swerving away outside off, there are no slips in place, which means the thick edge runs away to the third-man boundary

Parnell is tearing his hair out after a frustrating few minutes, this time an inside-edge past the stumps and the diving keeper for four more, it started with that dive in vain at the end of the previous over
well outside off, Sangakkara chases and misses
length ball on off stump, defended to the off side
Kusal attempting another wild pull to a shortish ball, thick bottom edge, Tsotsobe can't believe that didn't go on to hit the stumps, Perera survives
back of a length ball on the leg stump, Kusal moves across and helps the ball down to fine leg
short ball on the stumps, Sangakkara moves across and wants to work that down to fine leg, he misses
angling in towards the batsman, Sangakkara misses as he looks to drop the ball towards the leg side, he is struck on the box
short of length and just outside off, Sangakkara moves across and sends that towards deep backward square leg, Parnell gets across quickly to keep it to a single
length ball on off stump, slower one from Tsotsobe, defended towards cover, end of a top spell from Tsotsobe, 14 dot balls and he takes 2 for 17, could have had more wickets too
pitched up and around off, defended towards point
full ball swinging towards the pads, Sangakkara looked to whip that away towards deep square leg, can only edge it behind square
defended off the front foot to the off side

Tsotsobe was good with the ball, but is pretty poor in the field, that should have been another dot ball, it was shortish and outside off, played straight to Tsotsobe at backward point, a misfield allows a single, and horrible mid-pitch throw nearly allows another

nearly a run-out there, Kusal it seems is not just wild with his stroke-play, he dashes off for the single even though Sangakkara doesn't leave the crease after dropping the ball at his feet, Wiese rushes towards the ball, a direct hit would have caught Kusal well short
pushed towards mid-off for a quick single
flighted first ball from Tahir, worked towards cover for another quick single

Kusal's troubled stay in the middle is over, Tahir has struck with his second ball, was that pitching outside leg? Kusal went for the reverse-sweep and didn't connect, a huge appeal to that flighted googly, replays shows it was just outside leg
Thirimanne gets off the mark with a single to long-off
down to long-on for a single
gives it more air, clipped behind square leg for a single
skips down the track and pushes the ball towards mid-on past a diving Tahir for a single
Sangakkara skips beyond leg stump, and connects superbly as he lashes that towards sweeper cover
targetting the inexperienced Wiese here, Sangakkara shuffles across and paddles that towards fine leg
looks to drive this full ball, thick inside-edge to the leg side
full ball that was pitching outside leg and heading for the pads, not the best line that, eaasily helped to the fine-leg boundary
length ball, Wiese shifts his line outside off, a thick outside edge towards backward point
shortish ball is powerfully pulled towards deep midwicket, placement needed to be better, just the single
driven down to long-on for a single
gives this plenty of air, outside off, behind point for a single
works this towards midwicket, putting pressure on the fielder there, it was Duminy, batsmen race back for the second
the googly from Tahir, Sangakkara doesn't read it and there is a top edge towards deep point, lands safe
helped to midwicket for a single, Thirimanne wisely not trying the big hits here, happy to leave that role to the in-form Sangakkara
wants to pull that off the back foot, the googly again, doesn't connect
drives that off the front foot towards sweeper cover
first ball is launched over the umpire's head for four, the ump ducks for safety
slower offcutter on the stump, helped towards cover for a single
a full ball outside off is helped towards Tsotsobe at third man, two taken
full and outside off, again wants to run it down and is beaten
full ball outside off once more, looks to drive this one and misses again, eight off the over despite the final two dot balls
full ball on the pads, worked towards deep midwicket, seemed like a tight second, but the throw was weak from Duminy
flighted and full outside off, can't get under that one, pushed back towards the bowler
stays back and clips this towards Duminy at midwicket
clipped to midwicket for a single
gets to that on the full, worked towards wide mid-on for a single
clipped towards wide mid-on for a single
comes in from a good length outside off and even as he shuffles across he is not able to guide it past point

Tahir has misjudged this chance at fine leg, he ran in as Thirimanne top-edged a pull, Tahir ran in but stopped very early and was far away from the ball when it came down, this wind is not making it any easier for fielders to judge how the ball is going to come down
wants to drive but is done in  by slight inward shape
makes room and slogs, gets it over midwicket, who chases, deep square comes across, long on goes to his left and reaches it first, just in time, too

got him now, Thirimanne has had one slog too many, tried to launch this pitched up delivery over midwicket again, but it came in late from outside off, beat the almighty heave, and pinged the off stump
right on off stump, good length, hurrying on, bouncing extra, Angelo goes across but has to block
turns a good length delivery off his pad but there is square leg in the circle
a slower one, pitched up around off, Angelo comes forward to knock it to long on
saw him coming down and angled it in full outside leg stump, Sanga was cramped and could only turn it to midwicket
Angelo holes out, it is down to Thisara now, Mathews has dragged a slog from outside off and the mishit is a straightforward catch for long on, it was a slow cutter, that did him in
gets off the mark guiding a full delivery through covers
starts running even as he clips this off the pad, but two men from the deep converge on it in front of square leg, and only one is to be had

Wiese sends back Sanga with a blinder! Sanga wanted to go over Wiese at extra cover, the ball was shortish and wide, nothing in it, but Sanga could not get enough bat on it, Wiese back-pedalled at the edge of the circle, took it above his head and managed to hold on as he fell to the ground
wide again, a lot fuller though, Thisara flays at it and collects a thick-edged boundary fine to third man
gets some more width and punches through point, comes back for the second comfortably
shortish, wide, leaving him on the angle, and Perera has a swing, and a miss
the Morkel lifter, short of a length, outside off stump, Thisara prods and is beaten, steep bounce
dabbed to third man for one
a quick googly from Tahir, gets the outside edge from Perera, lobs towards backward point, bounces through to Morkel
backs away and flatbats it towards long-on for a single
googly once more from Tahir, nudged towards midwicket for a single by Kulasekara
skips down the track and skews it over point, towards deep point for one more
Tahir has a loud multi-stage lbw appeal, 'how is that?', 'how is that?' he screams even after the umpire has turned it down, that struck Kula's pads outside off as he looked to mow it to the leg side
chopped towards cover to end another good over for South Africa
looks to tap this to the leg side but bottom-edges it on to the pads
Perera looking for the big hit, can't time it at all and can only send it as far as cover
short ball outside off, Kulasekara swings and misses
on the pads, looks to whip this to the leg side, off the thigh pad and to the left of the keeper
low full toss on off stump, seems like there won't be any Perera magic today, he can't only punch this towards long-on for a single
a yorker just outside leg stump, completely cramping up Kulasekara, who can only get that away towards midwicket for another single
there's one of the many big hits Sri Lanka need, gets the front leg out of the way and launches that short of length ball way over long-on for six

and if Sri Lanka thought that six could kickstart a fightback, it doesn't, the very next ball is full and just outside off, a thick edge through to the keeper, Kula is gone, and Sri Lanka's hopes continue to fade
full and outside off, driven towards mid-off for a single
a knee-high full toss just outside off, Thisara Perera powers that between long-off and sweeper cover, doesn't carry all the way, landing just short of the rope
Perera backs away from the stumps, Morkel follows him with a yorker, Perera squeezes it out towards cover, declines the single
once more Morkel follows Perera, this is superb bowling from Morkel, Perera once again can't swing his arms, edges it onto his body and a single results
28 needed off 5 balls now as Perera swings and misses a shortish ball outside off stumps
heaves this away over mid-off, only gets two for his efforts
full and well outside off, Perera backed away from the stumps, can't reach the ball, perhaps got a thin bottom edge as the ball bounces through to the keeper
flat bats that over the bowler's head for two more, couldn't get any timing on that, hit low on the bat
a perfect yorker from Parnell, that was tailing in towards the batsman, Perera looks to hammer that down the ground but misses
full ball on the stumps is lashed to long-on, South Africa take the series 2-0, Faf du Plessis is overjoyed as is the rest of the South African camp, much-needed relief after a horrid one-day series
